bioghist.p: Father Edward George Dohan (1870-1936) was born in Troy, New York. He entered the Augustinian novitiate at Villanova, Pennsylvania, in 1895, and was ordained in 1899. He was stationed on Staten Island, New York, until 1906 when he became pastor of the newly established church of Saint Nicholas of Tolentine in the Bronx, New York. Father Dohan was appointed president of Villanova College in 1910 and held that position until 1917, after which he became Rector of Saint Josephâ€™s in Greenwich, New York. From 1920 to 1926, he was in charge of Our Mother of Good Counsel parish, and of the Augustinian Academy, on Staten Island, New York. Father Dohan thus became the first Rector of the Academy, (school for Augustinian Postulants) when it was moved from Villanova to Staten Island. He also remained its first Rector when it was moved from Austin Place to Grimes Hill on Staten Island. Later he served at Greenwich and Troy, New York.

scopecontent.p: The Edward G. Dohan papers is a very small collection consisting of correspondence, news media, and documents related to a 1911 Engineering scholarship competition. The correspondence deals with academic accreditation. Newspaper clippings include articles on Father Edward G. Dohan's installation as the president of the College and one article on the Villanova Association. Documentation of the Engineering scholarship includes a letter from Father Dohan outlining the program, a postcard announcement of the scholarship, lists of geometry, physics, trigonometry, and algebra problems, and two forms related to the competition.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
